topic: trump administration's capture of maduro raises unease about the international legal framework

text: The Trump administration's reported involvement in the capture of Nicolas Maduro, the Venezuelan president, has sparked concerns about the international legal framework.
Nicolas Maduro is the president of Venezuela.
The international legal framework is a complex system that governs the interactions between nations.
The US Department of Justice indicted Maduro on charges of narco-terrorism.
Narco-terrorism is a serious crime that threatens global security.
The capture of Nicolas Maduro would be a significant development in the region.
Sovereign nations have the right to enforce their own laws and maintain their own justice systems.
Global justice is a concept that seeks to promote fairness and equality across nations.
Venezuela is a country in South America.
The US actions against Maduro highlighted the complexities of international law.
International law is a system of rules that govern the interactions between nations.
The complexities of international law pose significant challenges for nations.
The role of sovereign nations in enforcing global justice is crucial.
Enforcing global justice requires international cooperation and collaboration.
